info.title: Dynamic Health
info.description: MedsAPI Dynamic Health Endpoints.  The documentation on this site covers all supported functionality of the MedsAPI suite of APIs. Any fields or parameters not represented by the documentation are unsupported and subject to change. Additional optional query parameters and fields in the response could be added in the future as a non breaking change. Any other change that could break the contract would be considered in a future version.

tags.name: Content Exclusions
tags.description: Dynamic Health Article/Content Set Exclusions Endpoints

refresh_token_expires_in.description: The number of seconds remaining before the refresh token will expire.  The lifespan of refresh tokens is usually larger than Access tokens. The exact duration depends on the type of Refresh Tokens issued. The different types explained below in the document.

developer.email.description: Name of the owener of the token

token_type.description: Always set to be a bearer token

issued_at.description: Epoch time when the token was issued

client_id.description: Client Id that the token can be used by

application_name.description: Id of the application that is registered for this token

expires_in.description: Seconds until this token has expired

refresh_count.description: When this token can be refreshed automatically

status.description: Indicates that the token has been approved

401.description: Unauthorized - This request requires authentication and none was provided.

403.description: Forbidden - The authentication credentials do not have access to this resource.

404.description: Not Found - The server was unable to find a resource matching this request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The server has not implemented the requested HTTP method.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The server cannot return the requested media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server cannot understand the media type in this request.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The client has sent too many requests within the given time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - There was an unexpected error with the server

client_id.description: The client_id to use will be provided by EBSCO

client_secret.description: This will be provided by EBSCO

post.description: The authentication endpoint for getting a token, used in all other Dynamic Health APIs.

post.summary: Search for DH content and information using POST.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.  Defaults to the highest value allowed: 30.  Set pageSize to 0 to retrieve a response without an items array.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to return.  Not needed on the first call.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A string token used by the search engine to retrieve the next set of results. Must be supplied if page parameter is supplied.  Returned in the response of the first page of results.

query.description: A term or terms to search.

sort.description: Order in which results will appear.

filters.description: List of types that will be used for searching and aggregations.

categoryPaths.description: One or more categories to include in the results.

specialties.description: One or more specialties to include in the results.

aggregations.description: One or more fields to aggregate counts in the response.

fields.description: Fields that should be included in the response.

token.description: The term(s) that were searched. This could be multiple terms if they were used together in the search.

title.example: Automated External Defibrillation in a Pediatric Patient

description.example:
Assisting in restoring or maintaining cerebrospinal
fluid flow

hitSummary.description:
Indicates whether an exact match to the query
was used in the aggregation count foe this item.

titleExactMatch.description:
Indicates if the query term matched exactly
to the topic title.

specialties.description: List of specialties related to the article.

populations.description: Population that this article is relevant to.

images.description: List of any images in the topic.

copyright.description: Copyright and date of the image.
copyright.example:
Copyright© Madhero88, 2011. Licensed under
Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported
License

title.example: Heel Sticks On a Newborn Or Infant.

videos.description: List of any videos in the topic.

copyright.description: Copyright and date of the video.
copyright.example:
Copyright© Madhero88, 2011. Licensed under
Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported
License

title.example: Performing a Heelstick in an Infant.

get.summary: Get a list of search suggestions, either word completions (term) or article completions (title), based on the users access.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Word or phrase to search for an article title or a term against. Can be a single character or partial term.

parameters.name: maxItemsPerSuggestionType
parameters.description: The maximum number of search suggestions to return for each suggestion type (term or article title)

parameters.name: pubTypeGroup
parameters.description: Publication Groups to include in results

parameters.name: completionType
parameters.description: Search results should match these fields: term or title (default is both)

post.description: Return answers and references to questions from DynaMedex content

parameters.name: x-eis-id-token
parameters.description: id token

parameters.name: Connection
parameters.description: Keep the connection alive until done

parameters.name: X-Accel-Buffering-Type
parameters.description: Send the responses as they are received

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Do not cache responses

parameters.name: imageSize
parameters.description: Specify small (200w), medium (500w) and large (1000w) image sizes are supported. Also, the full image size is supported and is the default if no image size was specified.

parameters.name: mediaLinksFormat
parameters.description: Returns a secure link in its original size. Options are server or browser (default).

parameters.name: convertSvg
parameters.description: Return images and algorithms that are originally in svg format as png format when true.

query.example: what is the cause of hypercalcemia in a 35 year old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB and abnormal lab values

conversationId.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

messageId.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

query.example: what is the cause of hypercalcemia in a 35 year old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB and abnormal lab values
query.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

question.example: What are the potential causes of hypercalcemia in a 35-year-old woman with squamous cell lung cancer, granulomatous TB, and abnormal lab values?
question.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

response.example:
• Hypercalcemia can result from malignancies such as squamous cell carcinoma of the lung, which is associated with hypercalcemia of malignancy. This condition is often caused by the release of parathyroid hormone-related protein (PTHrP) from cancer cells, leading to increased calcium reabsorption in the kidney and stimulation of osteoclast activity, resulting in elevated calcium levels.1,2
  • Granulomatous disorders, including tuberculosis (TB), can also cause hypercalcemia. These conditions may lead to increased production of calcitriol, which stimulates gastrointestinal calcium absorption and osteoclastic activity, further elevating calcium levels.1,2
  • Abnormal lab values such as elevated PTHrP levels, low or normal PTH levels, and elevated vitamin D levels may indicate hypercalcemia of malignancy or other underlying causes such as granulomatous disorders.3,4
response.description: Required if asking a follow-up question.  Pulled from the previous response.

query.description: The primary concept for the question.  This helps to focus the question.
query.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

question.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

answer.example: In infants, the evaluation for congenital heart disease (CHD) involves...

supported.description: Indicates if this query is supported.

answerFound.description: Indicates that the answer has been found.

conceptCount.description: The number of medical concepts covered by the query

conversationId.description: Identifier to be used for subsequent requests

messageId.description: Reflects the number of queries for this Dyna conversation

content.example: Dyna AI responses are for educational purposes only and should not be solely relied upon for medical practice.

moreContent.example: The presentation of a response does not imply any specific ranking by importance or probability and a response may not include all possibly relevant material. Interpretation and application are subject to the judgment of a healthcare professional. Dyna AI responses are not intended to serve as recommendations for individual patients. Do not enter Protected Health Information (PHI).

message.example: A note from your workplace is included that should be reviewed. (Notes are not included in the Dyna AI response)
message.description: A message to be displayed when notes are used to form an answer

message.example: One or more related 'Your Workplace Skills' exist and are not included in this Dyna AI response
message.description: A message to call attention that the answer includes a workplace skill.

title.example: Case Management for Patients with Diabetes Workplace Skill

id.description: ID of the skill which can be used with the custom article endpoint

references.description: References used to provide the answer

hasNotes.description: Indicates if there are workplace notes in any results. Only can be true if workplace notes exist in Dynamic Health or the reference.

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD) >

title.description: Title of the specific section on the page cited in the answer

slug.description: Slug to the page and section

refIndex.description: Matches to the “1” in the answer

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)

hasNote.description: Indicates if any section has workplace notes. Only can be true if workplace notes exist in Dynamic Health or the reference.

metadata.description: This section is used as a reference in the answer

title.description: Title of the Article used in the answer
title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)

streamComplete.description: Flag to indicate if the streaming response is complete

id.description: ID of the image, which can be used with the media endpoint

publicId.description: Public ID, for those with access to Cloudinary

description.example: (A) Chest radiograph reveals poorly defined bilateral nodular opacities in the superior lung fields. (B) Axial computed tomography image of the chest shows centrilobular ground-glass nodules and heterogeneous attenuation, features suggestive of calcium deposition.

copyright.example: © 2010 Massachusetts Medical Society. All rights reserved. Used with permission.

alt.example: (A) Chest radiograph reveals poorly defined bilateral nodular opacities in the superior lung fields. (B) Axial computed tomography image of the chest shows centrilobular ground-glass nodules and heterogeneous attenuation, features suggestive of calcium deposition.
alt.description: Alternate text to display if the image is not rendered

id.description: ID of the algorithm, which can be used with the media endpoint

publicId.description: Public ID, for those with access to Cloudinary

description.example: Adapted from Pediatr Nephrol. 2018 Sep;33(9):1475-1488, Clin Med. (Lond) 2017 Jun;17(3):270-273, BMJ. 2015 Jun 2;350:h2723. Last reviewed 2025.

alt.example: Adapted from Pediatr Nephrol. 2018 Sep;33(9):1475-1488, Clin Med. (Lond) 2017 Jun;17(3):270-273, BMJ. 2015 Jun 2;350:h2723. Last reviewed 2025.
alt.description: Alternate text to display if the image is not rendered

recommendedQuestions.description: Suggested follow-up questions from Dyna AI related to the original query

recommendedContent.description: Recommended content related to the answer

hasNotes.description: Indicates if content contains a  workplace note when the request is for Dynamic Health.

enabled.description: Indicates if followup queries may be asked

searchTerm.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

question.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

pageToken.description: Token used for tracking a session

messageId.description: The number of questions related to this query

userIntentTimeInMs.description: Time for the entire answer to be completed

answerFound.description: Indicates if there is an answer

answerNotFound.description: Indicates if there is an answer - this is needed for EBSCO statistics

conceptCount.description: The number of medical concepts covered by the query

disclaimer.description: Indicates whether or not the query intent category triggered a disclaimer that was included with the answer

imageCount.description: Number of images in the response

get.summary: Get all Dyna AI Conversations for a user
get.description: Gets basic information on all conversations for the specified user. Only returns the top-level (question, query, timestamp) information for the most recent message in the conversation.

parameters.description: Filter conversations by bookmark status

completedPhrase.description: The full text of the matching suggestion.

links.description: Related links for navigating the API.

href.description: Absolute URL pointing to the resource.

method.description: The HTTP method to be used with the related link.

request.description: In a search link, the request that can be used to search the content set.

query.description: In the request for a search link, the completed phrase to provide to the search service.

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp when the conversation was created

query.description: The original query/search term from the conversation

question.description: The processed question from the conversation

telemetryData.description: Telemetry information for tracking and analytics

SelfLink.description: A link object representing a relationship and its URL

question.example: How do I evaluate an Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)-389hsqogd6

answer.example: In infants, the evaluation for congenital heart disease (CHD) involves...

supported.description: Indicates where Dyna supports this type of question

answerFound.description: Indicates if this response includes the final answer

conversationId.description: ID of the rag search conversation

messageId.description: ID of the message in the conversation

createdAt.description: ISO8601 timestamp when the conversation was created

title.description: Title for the follow-up questions section

enabled.description: Indicates if follow-up questions are enabled for this conversation

content.example: Dyna AI responses are for educational purposes only and should not be solely relied upon for medical practice.

moreContent.example: The presentation of a response does not imply any specific ranking by importance or probability and a response may not include all possibly relevant material. Interpretation and application are subject to the judgment of a healthcare professional. Dyna AI responses are not intended to serve as recommendations for individual patients. Do not enter Protected Health Information (PHI).
moreContent.description: Additional disclaimer content for the conversation

workplaceNotes.description: Contains a message to display to users indicating there are workplace notes associated with the Dyna AI response.  Only included for DH users and only when there are workplace notes associated with the Dyna AI response.

message.example: A note from your workplace is included that should be reviewed. (Notes are not included in the Dyna AI response)
message.description: User-facing messaging to notify the user there are workplace notes associated with the Dyna AI response.

workplaceSkills.description: Object indicating whether or not there are workplace skills associated with the Dyna AI response. Only included for DH users and only when there are workplace skills associated with the Dyna AI response.

message.example: One or more related 'Your Workplace Skills' exist and are not included in this Dyna AI response
message.description: User-facing messaging to notify the user there are workplace skills associated with the Dyna AI response.

url.description: URL to more information about the workplace skill

id.description: Unique identifier for the workplace skill

References.description: References used to provide the answer

hasNotes.description: Indicates if this reference is coming from a workplace note

slug.description: Slug to the page and section

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)

hasNote.description: Indicates if this reference has a workplace note

title.example: Evaluation of the Infant for Congenital Heart Disease (CHD)
title.description: Title of the Article used in the answer

RecommendedContent.description: Recommended content related to the answer

hasNotes.description: Indicates if there is recommended content whether it is from a workplace note

RecommendedQuestions.description: Questions that might be used for followup on this answer.

messageId.description: ID of the message in the conversation

userIntentTimeInMs.description: Time for the entire answer to be completed

userIntentCategory.description: The category that the user seems to be querying

answerFound.description: Indicates if an answer was found for the user's query

answerNotFound.description: Indicates if an answer was not found for the user's query

disclaimer.description: Indicates if there is a disclaimer associated with the answer

id.description: Unique identifier for the media item

publicId.description: Public identifier for the media item

copyright.description: Copyright information for the media item

alt.description: Alt text for the media item

thumbnails.description: Thumbnail URLs for images at different sizes. Only present for image pubType.
